{"step_by_step_thinking": "VDO stands for Vertical Dimension of Occlusion, which is the distance measured between two points when the occluding surfaces are in contact. If the VDO is increased, it can lead to a strained facial appearance due to the overstretching of facial muscles. It can also cause trauma to underlying tissues because of the increased pressure. Clicking of teeth can also be a result of increased VDO as the teeth may not fit together properly. Therefore, all of the options are potential consequences of increased VDO.", "answer_choice": "D. All of the above"}
